description: A mapping spreadsheet must have all of the original tabs from the template.  Unneeded tabs may be hidden (not deleted) by the user.

A mapping spreadsheet must have all of the original columns from the template.  Columns are identified by cell names in the first row, so users may rearrange columns, add new columns, and/or change the column header if desired, but the cell name must remain the same.
exampleValid: The Property tab should have a column for the mapping code identified by cell name 'Property_Mapping_Code' in the first row.

description: Each row in the mapping spreadsheet must have a valid mapping code.  Mapping codes explain how each row should be processed.
In each row, certain fields may be required based on the mapping code that is used.
exampleValid: For a row with mapping code 'add', the target prefix, name, and definition fields are required.

description: Name-only columns cannot be qualified (no namespace prefix) - e.g., "Person".
exampleValid: For the 'Property Name' column in the 'Property' tab, a valid name would be 'Person'.
exampleInvalid: For the 'Property Name' column in the 'Property' tab, an invalid name would be 'nc:Person'.

description: Qualified name columns must include a namespace prefix - e.g., "nc:Person".
exampleValid: For the 'Qualified Data Type' column in the 'Property' tab, a valid qname would be 'nc:PersonType' (includes the namespace prefix).
exampleInvalid: For the 'Qualified Data Type' column in the 'Property' tab, an invalid qname would be 'PersonType' (no namespace prefix).

description: A property must have a valid style or be left blank to indicate that the property is an element.
exampleValid: Valid styles are 'element', 'attribute', 'abstract', or a blank value (defaults to 'element').

description: A type row must have a valid style value if given.
A subProperty row must have an integer as the min value, if given.
exampleValid: Valid values are integers and include 0, 1, or a blank value (defaults to 0).
exampleInvalid: Invalid values include "required", "optional", and other strings.

description: A subProperty row must have a "unbounded" or a positive integer as the max value, if given.
exampleValid: Valid values are "unbounded", positive integers, or a blank value.

description: A facet row must have a valid style if given.
A namespace must have a valid style.
